Summary Heading: Comfortable RV Park, Close to Disneyland
Summary: This was our 2nd time at the Anaheim Harbor RV Park.  The staff is always very friendly and helpful.  It is a small RV Park, with small spots, but it is well kept.  We stay here for the vicinity to Disneyland, and it works perfect.  It's a 10-12 minute bike ride away to the entrance of Downtown Disney.  For safety we ride our bikes on the sidewalks, as it is a busy area.  You can see the fireworks at night.  Easy on and off the freeway location.

Summary Heading: Awesome RV place, walking distance to Disney
Summary: We had an amazing time here, stayed here to be close to Disneyland Resort. We were able to view the fireworks from our campsite which was awesome. The pool is nice and warm, nice RV sites with a patch of fake grass (nice and clean) and an awesome picnic table and umbrella.

Excellent place to stay and affordable for our adventure to Disneyland. Staff was very appealing with us as we didn't arrive in the checkout window but were able to take care of everything over the phone. Amenities are great and aside from the noisy street we had no issues. Only thing I would say is try and get a spot further into the lot as Harbor Blvd is a very busy street no matter what time of day. Overall great place and we will definitely stay here again for our next trip.
Room tip: Try and get a space further into the lot away from Harbor Blvd.

Summary: We stayed 2 nights at the campsite. The lady at the reception was very friendly. The camping is clean and has a nice little pool.It has many permanent campers but that didn't bother us. The location to Diesneyland was great. 20 walkway. But the price was very, very high. We would recommend it

Summary Heading: An oasis in our stressful trip.
Summary: Traveling at the holidays for a family emergency wasn't a fun trip. The Anaheim Harbor park was an oasis for us. Spots are a bit tight but this is prime real estate being so close to Disneyland. I changed my reservations several times, but everyone was helpful and kind. Nice, secure park, clean bathrooms, and fireworks every night! A nice laundry,  fire pit and bbq area, too. Would definitely stay here again.
Room tip: This is not a hotel, it is an RV park

Summary: We love this park. Super clean. Super friendly and helpful employees. Convenient little mini mart with ice and snacks and a few RV accessories if needed! Close proximity to the park… awesome fireworks every night at 9pm, grills, hot tubs… safe and quiet. We will always stay here when we visit Anaheim!

Summary Heading: Back again for the Disney Experience.
Summary: Second time we stayed at this in town park. Check in was a breeze, receptionists were nice to work with. They asked about our stay and plans and provided helpful information that fit into our plan. Our first visit here was exactly one year ago to the day. It was just as pleasant. Fair prices too. Great fireworks display overhead. Only issue, which is not the parks fault, there are dumpsters just behind the hedge on adjoining property, SW side, which makes for a very noisy early morning  wake up call. We will be back again. "Thanks" Rick

We arrived at 5:00 p.m., closing time for the office. Our reservation information was waiting in an envelope. As we were setting up, the young woman in the office was walking to her car and asked me if I'd like to take care of our payment or wait till the next day. So she went back into the office and took care of our reservation as well as provided me with additional information that proved very helpful during our stay. Great customer service and a great location. We will definitely be back!

Nice location about a 1/2 mile walk to Disneyland-note you do need to walk over the freeway over pass, but it is paved and we always felt safe (even at night). We also loved that we had a fantastic view of the fireworks. Would definitely stay here again when we are in town for a Disney visit--and Shakey's is right next door and had yummy pizza.

This is a great place to stay if you are heading to Disneyland. It is located less than a mile from the park and is an easy quick walk. Their location and prices are amazing. The grounds are clean and the staff is very helpful and friendly.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay in your RV to visit Disneyland
Summary: This was our second visit to Anaheim Harbor and have enjoyed both stays. Staff is friendly and helpful and the park is clean and well maintained.  We love the nightly fireworks shows as well. We will definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: Great Stay at Anaheim Harbor RV park
Summary: Great time at Anaheim Harbor RV park. Location to Disneland was so convenient. Walked and used ART bus. As seniors to bus ticket of $2.50 per day was so reasonable and very convenient. Parking site was large with patio area. Front desk staff was polite and answered all my questions. Will definitely stay again when in LA area.

Summary Heading: AVOID THIS PLACE!We did not feel safe
Summary: Appears to be a decent stop for a Disney vacation, but has fulltime residents that are out of control. One night the Jayco Class C next door had a full load of little boys (a dozen or so), with no apparent adult around. After 10 pm we asked them to quite down and where were their parents? It was wierd, kids started scattering and running to other Rvs. Adults, several loaded in cars, started coming from the back of the park and collecting children. It was spooky, I was afraid one of the cars would run over a kid. Somehow they managed to avoid squishing a child. Finally, one child told me his Dad was asleep inside the Jayco. I was astonished since the noise level had been extreme for HOURS. A man came over and said some of the kids were his.  We asked them to observe the quite

Summary Heading: Dead quiet after Disney Fireworks at 9:30
Summary: Best price around. 20 minute walk to the security point of Disneyland. Dead quiet after Disney fireworks at 9:30. Clean. Extremely friendly staff. But it really is no frills no gimmicks. The spaces are small but they seem to give the one next to you for parking so that is VERY NICE! We will stay here EVERY TIME we head to SoCal. We cam from Mt. Hood area of Oregon. We came in, checked in quickly. Hook up was fast. WiFi is strong throughout the park. Left and right level was nearly dead on just needed to adjust front jack. Close to shopping for the needed extras (That was a huge plus)You can walk 2 different ways to the park form this place. Shakes pizza is right in front (Great Pizza!). I probably should not post this good of a review because people will start to flock

Great proximity to Disneyland, very clean super friendly staff. We will definitely stay there again   Very wide spaces plenty of parking for an extra car if you have one   Less than a few blocks from Disneyland entrance

Super friendly staff, very clean, comfortable temp in clean swimming pool. Loved the experience!! Close to Disneyland. Full hook ups. Clean restrooms and showers. Will stay again! Near freeway on ramp. Keurig coffee to purchase for $1 a cup, many flavors. Felt very safe, security on premise.

I loved the park. The park was clean, the staff was friendly. Loved that it was only about 15 minute walk to Disneyland. I would stay here again. The price they charge help make our vacation a little more magical.

The staff were reat. Very helpful. The spaces could use some updating but everything worked! The acess to Disneyland was easy, cheap and quick. The park is very clean and the pool although small was well maintained.

We booked in for 7 nights as we drove down from Vancouver to meet up with family at Disneyland  We got a call to confirm our arrival on the day of, I let them know we were going to be quite late. We pulled in around midnight, the security guard was very friendly and helpful, she pointed out where office was and that our paperwork was left on the door for us. The sites are decent size, premises are very clean, the showered and washrooms are also kept vey clean. The office staff is very friendly and helpful. The location is ideal, a 15 minute walk to DL or a quick ART ride, we bought the 5 day pass.  I will stay here again and recommend this location

We had a wonderful time and when we come back to Disneyland we will definitely use this site again!  Clean, full support/services, and very close to Disneyland.  Fireworks show was amazing.  Nice and safe and quiet.

Summary Heading: Perfect stay at a perfect RV park, we loved it.
Summary: We stayed here with our family, 2 adults and 2 kids. The RV park is very good and clean, personnel is very friendly and helpful. All amenities are good. The RV park is very near Disneyland and the Anaheim ART bus stop, which is very convenient. The fireworks can be seen at the park! We will definitely stay here again if we are in the neighbourhood or when visiting Disneyland again.

I was able to stay at both RV parks Anaheim and Anaheim Harbor. We really appreciated the courtesy and friendly service that we received at Anaheim Harbor. I had to change and rearrange reservations and they were a wonderful help! They even put us in touch with a local car rental service on short notice. A great stay! We walked to the park in the morning and Ubered back from the park at night. Uber was $10 and really quick.

Summary Heading: Best Deal On The  West Coast
Summary: We traveled in an Escape Campervan from San Diego to Seattle. Your resort was the best value we found on the whole West Coast. I had made a one night reservation for our trip at your resort and we loved it so much that we stayed the second night. Everyone one was friendly , helpful and full of information of the the area. The laundry room was very clean and the prices were very budget friendly. The coffee and Snack area were a pleasant addition as we had no coffee maker with us. The pool was clean and refreshing. You can even see Disney fireworks every night.

It was a great experience and we enjoyed the location of the park to Disneyland as that was our primary reason for visiting Anaheim. It was very convenient to be able to ride the shuttle to and from the park and not have to worry about driving. It was nice to be able to see the fireworks every night and our 2-year-old daughter loved it! The park itself was nice and the girls in the office were very nice and helpful. The facilities were nice and having shower facilities was great and helpful after using an  RV shower for a few weeks. We will definitely return when we visit Anaheim again.

Perfect location near the park, nightly fireworks right over our heads. Staff was super friendly. Bathrooms were clean and clubhouse was well stocked. The front spaces are close together but there was plenty of room.

Spend a night there so my family could go to a angels game. The park was nice and clean. The checkin was easy and the staff was very helpful. They have a little swiming pool and was very clean. They had a maintaince person constandly keeping the park nice.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when visiting Disneyland or Knott's Berry farm
Summary: What can I say other than this is a great RV park!  It's clean with good security. It has a nice pool for cooling off in the afternoon, it's close to Disneyland, Knott's Berry farm, and other attractions. The staff is friendly and helpful. We've stated this park numerous times and it ranks as one of our favorites! We'll be back!

Stopped here for a night with family on our way to carnival Cruise terminal. Very clean and well maintained! There weren't very many showers, but the ones that were there were very nice. Surprisingly quiet at night. Staff was very friendly. We were very impressed with the overall experience. Incredible value! Highly recommend.

I booked to be close to amusement parks. The website pics were not that inviting but the spaces were roomy with an rv and car spot, the picnic tables and umbrella were new and the artificial turf at every spot made the place look well kept. Bath/showers were clean, pool was nice, and shaded gathering area with bbqs and gas firepits were great for hanging out. We had a nice surprise with a nightly fireworks show from Disneyland...great location...would recommend!!

After reading the reviews we were pleasantly surprised to find Anaheim Harbor even better than we expected. The park was clean and quiet, the restrooms and showers were very nice. The shuttle to Disneyland stops just a few feet from the park but didn't run late enough for us to catch a ride back so we walked and it really wasn't too far even for two seniors. Be sure and let the bus driver know if you are 65 or over and the fare is really cheap. The staff and management were more than helpful and very friendly and we will definitely be back.

Summary Heading: I would recommend Anaheim Harbor RV Park.
Summary: Anaheim RV Resort is a nice resort located in town so its very close to stores, public transportation and most importantly (to us), only a few blocks from Disneyland.  The park is clean and well maintained and ample parking is provided.  The office was closed when we arrived but all of our check-in information was left for us where we could easily find it.  The staff is friendly and knowledgable about the area and were most helpful.

This was a great location for Disney. We were able to walk everyday and save on parking. The place was one of the cleanest I have ever seen and although in a busy area, it felt extremely safe. In addition, you get an unobstructed view of the Disney fireworks every night at 9:30 from the comfort of your own pad. The pool area was immaculate and the water was crystal clear. It is pricey but we are not city folk and are use to getting much more space for our buck. All in all the location made it worth paying a little extra. The only real downside was that the back of the park is permanent residents and many of those units were trashy. They do a good job separating the two areas but you can’t help notice the “night and day” difference between the two spots. I would recommend this to

Our first stay here. we found the place easy to find. Adequate facilities though the bathrooms could do with an upgrade. Getting to Disneyland was a breeze, even if you wanted to walk. We could watch the fireworks each night. A bonus!

We stayed for 7 days. Staff was Amazing, clean bathrooms and showers and quiet no freeway sounds.Pay the few bucks for the deluxe upgrade with grass and a picnic table to watch the Fireworks every night

Stayed here for 3 days and had a great spot with nice neighbors. The office couldn’t have been nicer with lots of information.  You are a short Uber or Lyft ride from the Disneyland/California Adventure Parks.  Great RV Park

Ladies at the front desk were very nice and helpful. Site was good size. View of fireworks was awesome! Pool was fun and laundry room was clean. We even used the grill and that worked great. We used the grill once and that was good. We can’t wait to come back and visit!

Summary Heading: Good place for your family of 5 to stay
Summary: A great location for an easy walk in and out of Disneyland. We felt safe with 3 kids aged 11-16. Clean restrooms and showers. The pool was great to cool off in. Community BBQ was handy and fireplace to enjoy at night to relax was really nice. And if you left the park early like we did, we enjoyed the fireworks. Great spot to be in for a Disneyland, Angels game stop. And Shakeys pizza right around the corner was really good.

This park was clean and convenient. Just a tad less than a mile to Disneyland. Staff was friendly and helpful. Best part is we had perfect view of Disney fireworks! Only negative was tight spaces, but we've found that to be true of any park in a city with a popular vacation destination.

Very convenient park to walk to Disneyland or take a bus, though bus not reliable for returning so walking is better option. Great fireworks viewing right from RV.  Pads seem to be sloped, so carry extra leveling pieces. Had RV pull in at 11:30pm next to us with loud truck and air wrench equipment, working for over an hour. Shouldn't be allowed to arrive so late. Stayed in deluxe space, which was protected from traffic noise.

Convenient to a Disneyland shuttle. The staff is friendly and welcoming. It's a small RV park compared to others that we stayed at on this trip, but it had everything we needed. We didn't use the pool or restrooms, but it was good to know that they were available. Easy check-in and check-out. For the hookups, it was difficult to reach with our hoses, but we made it work. Bring cash to pay for the shuttle if you're going to Disneyland. It was inexpensive and better than paying for parking. When you return from Disneyland, you'll get dropped off at a slightly different location (across the street) from where you get picked up, so just be aware of that! They also have wifi! And be sure to ask for a AAA or AARP discount! Call them instead of using the web site if you need a

Awesome place to stay if you are RV'ing.  The park is walking distance to Disneyland, restaurants, and the gas station.  The park was clean, and quiet.  The staff was very accommodating and friendly.  I would definitely stay there again!

Summary Heading: Great stay at a good RV site
Summary: Clean, tidy site. Good position near Disneyland in Los Angeles. Nice staff, polite and helpful. Good facilities: water, electricity, sewage. Easy to book by phone. Tight spaces, but this is a city site. I would come back here.

This is a great place to stay while visiting Disneyland!  The Fireworks are so close its will startel you if you aren't expecting it!!  :-)  Great little patio area to bbq.  The bathrooms and showers are old but have been refurbished and they are clean.  I never had to wait in line in the morning.  I don't like to take the city shuttle so we called Uber and it cost $6-$7 each way.   It is easy access from the freeway when hauling a trailer or driving a Motorhome.

I always enjoy my visit here.  It's always clean, and the staff is very friendly and helpful. It's close to Disneyland, just over a 10 minute walk, or you can talk the ART shuttle (although the shuttle times aren't always reliable- it used to be better).  I've stayed here several times, and I'll definitely be back! :)  Plus, you can see the fireworks show better here than anywhere at Disneyland!

Make sure to bring extra sewer hose and electrical extension cords. I read some of the reviews saying that you would need extra hose for black tanks, so I purchased some ahead of time, but still didn’t have enough! After we pulled in we had to find a camping world to purchase more hose and an extension cord for our 30 amp. It would be nice if they told you how far back the hookups are before you get there. Other than that it’s a nice place to stay if you’re visiting Disneyland. Friendly staff as well. Didn’t use the bathrooms or showers, but we did do laundry.

Awesome. Highly recommend. Nice people. Fireworks are right out your door. Walk to the park or take art. Outside seating areas are nice pool is nice. Showers were great. Book early and get away from Harbor Blvd. We stayed two spots away and it is a bit noisy.

This was our first stay at Anaheim Harbor RV Park. It was clean and the staff were friendly. The restrooms were clean, but small. We walked to Disneyland one day and it took about 15 minutes. The first night, we saw the Disneyland fireworks from our trailer. We had one space for our trailer and one space for our tow vehicle.

The parks staff are nice and friendly. The bathrooms were the cleanest I have seen in an RV Park it’s easy to tell the team that keeps the park up really care about the place. Plenty of room for laundry. If you are looking for a base camp for Disney and the surrounding area this place is perfect. We will be staying again, I would say opt to pay for a deluxe spot with the grass if you are planning to stay a week.

Friendly staff and very accommodating even when we made a couple of last minute changes to the reservation and then also arrived late on the first day. The site is near a freeway which can be noisy at night but a small price to pay being so close to Disneyland which you can walk to in around 15 mins.

Everything was basically ok, especially it being in such a big city however bathrooms could have been a bit cleaner and more facilities.    Pool was pretty crowded and kids jumping in and out of water, quite noisy.    Have barbeques which one can use which is nice and areas to sit and eat

We booked for 1 week.  It's was tight for room between trailers in some spots,  but your not there for sittingg around. If you have a larger trailer the park accommodate you with a second site for your vehicle. Its I'd a very clean place, friendly and has a night security guard.  When showering though early in the morning there can be a lineup,  so I suggest if you can use your RV. I know some people like to use the facilties. It is worth staying there if you are RVing  to Disneyland.  There is a bus stop just half a block away for ART bus system, which connects all routes at Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Leave the RV at him and shout yourself a hotel!
Summary: The park is very close to Disneyland and seeing the fireworks was a plus. The staff are helpful and nice.  However as mentioned in another post, it’s a car park with bathroom facilities.  I will also mention that the bathrooms are clean but the toilets are small.  There was a club house but even the coffee machine was broken. It would have been nice to have free coffee like other rv parks.  The back end of the site is for permanent residents and the front for short stays. People do come and go at all hours which makes the place noisy.  There are no trees or grass areas. The fake grass smells like animal urine, which is gross.  Next time I’ll be staying at a nearby hotel for a few extra dollars.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay at Disneyland!
Summary: The only place we will stay in Anaheim .  Very clean and friendly staff.  So close to Disneyland you can walk, ride the shuttle or Uber for under $10.00.  We had a better view of the fireworks from out RV spot than we had at Disneyland.  We have referred several families to this RV Resort.

Summary Heading: Place to stay if going to Disneyland
Summary: You are walking distance to Disneyland and you are able to watch the fireworks show from your RV every night! Showers are nice but toliet stalls are a little small. Staff is very welcoming and willing to help you with what ever you may need. I recommend Anaheim Harbor RV Park hands down!

The employees were friendly and helpful.  If you are looking for more than just a place to park your camper, then this is not the place.  This park is basically a glorified parking lot.  It suited us just fine as we planned to spend our entire time at Disney which is less than a mile away.  The shuttle is convenient to use instead of driving there.  It was a bit overpriced considering the lack of amenities, however I understand it was close to Disney and therefore a convenient location.  Would have liked to have a bit more security around the place as it seems to be in a shadier area of the city.  Overall though we had a good experience at the RV Park.

We stayed three nights during a brief Disneyland vacation. The back part of the campground seems to contain units for folks who have rented on a permanent or seasonal basis & there is a little ‘sprawl’ going on back there.  The front part was very neat & tidy. Small swimming pool that seemed very nice; but we did not use it.  Disneyland fireworks are quite noisy from here. But location is very convenient even to walk to Disneyland if you choose to.  Also served by the ART bus system.  Campsites are very close but considering you’re camping in the city, it’s understandable.

This place is great if you don't mind camping before walking into Disneyland. There are only 2 campsites for tenters but there are shower facilities nice parking spots and about 15 min walk to the park. Totally air pricing for being this close to the most popular fun park in the world. Definitely would stay again. Also, staff was super helpful and friendly

Summary Heading: Great place and walking distance to Disneyland.
Summary: Booked our campsite about 10 months in advance and let them know we had a teardrop and would need to be near the bathhouse.  Upon arrival, we were greeted by a very pleasant staff and shown our campsite.  It was very close to the bathhouse.  Excellent.  Our only complaint is that other campers would walk through our campsite in the morning and evening on there way to the bathhouse.  This isn't a complaint about the park, but a complaint about the rudeness of some of the other campers.  Our 3 days at this park were wonderful.

The RV park is quite nice.  Staff was very friendly and courteous.  I was dismayed that I had to purchase more sewer hose because of the utilities at the rear of the site.  We made the reservation by phone, which was done by my wife who did not receive or look at the email that was sent to inform of policies including the need for extra sewer hose.  Bathrooms, although very small, were nice and the showers were very hot and plenty of water.  Overall very nice park with a great location and friendly staff.

With RV sales reaching another all time sales record,  there are few too many options left in the greater Los Angeles area and almost none left in Anaheim.  This small park is easy walking distance to the Disney Resort. It's an older park so site size is an issue,  but they assign you 1 site for your RV and a second for your tow vehicle which works, nice little pool area and the tourist sites up front are acceptable if you can over look the full time living area of RVS at the back half. Nice staff. Restaurants nereby. Not perfect but only about 2 choices left. Great view of the nightly fireworks! !

Summary Heading: Walking distance to Disney, clean, safe, pleasant
Summary: Though this was not a luxury rv resort, I give it five stars for cleanliness, polite and helpful staff, price, and location. My primary reason for choosing this site over others was proximity to Disney. I was pleasantly surprised to find a facility in such good repair and a good vibe.  The restrooms and pool were cleaning well maintained. Our deluxe site was actually 2 sites. We picked our favorite and parked our boat in the other.   We brought a stroller. I was able to walk to Disney daily with our 4 year old in the stroller and felt safe enough returning around 10 pm each night on foot. There are some decent restaurants within walking distance as well.  I would stay here again.

I give them 5 stars for customer service and for working with us.  I give them 2 stars for describing their rv sites. The place was packed and there was no way we could get our rv into the site we were assigned even though our rv footage was acceptable. They were awesome about refunding us.

Summary Heading: A Gem of an RV Park
Summary: My husband, two dogs and I stayed here Feb 1,2,3. I had no idea when I set out to find a convenient RV park near Disneyland that it would be so easy!  This park filled all our needs; clean, near enough to be able to make a trip from DL back “home” to check on our dogs during the day, reasonably priced, and the office staff were very pleasant and helpful. We bought two $5 all day use tickets from the RV office for the Anaheim transit that brought us from the park right up to the DL ticket gates. That saved us $10 on all day parking. The bus made the circuit of hotels and the RV park every 20 minutes.   We stayed in a part of the RV park that could best be described as a level parking lot with hook ups. We got two spaces for the one price (one space for our 5th wheel and one for

We stayed here in our 32' motor home for 6 nights while visiting Disneyland. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There was a coin-operated laundry room and a pretty little picnic area in front with Astroturf. Spaces are merely paved parking spots (unless you get one with a picnic table), but then you won't be here to spend time at the RV park! We did not try the pool, but it looked nice. Full hookups worked well. Great place to stay! Note that the ART city bus only runs about once every 25 minutes and only during normal park hours (not Extra Magic hours). It's an easy 15-minute walk to the parks, especially for kids 6 and over.

We dropped in on their doorstep at Christmas time. No reservations and dog tired. Wendy worked her magic and found us spaces for our 4 night stay.  Saved our trip. Thank you Wendy.  Amenities are fine. Pool well kept. Tidy rv spaces. Night shift security guard was wonderful as well. Wish I had gotten her name.  Thanks again guys!

Summary Heading: Make for a GREAT Disneyland Visit
Summary: Convenient location, friendly staff, and good prices….the making of a great Disneyland adventure. The RV park is clean and has all the amenities for a comfortable overnight stay in between park visits. Great place to watch the DL fireworks without the park crowds.

Summary Heading: Great Park close to the park
Summary: It's great park close to food options and bus stop to the park. Although close enough to walk if needed/desired.  Harbor Blvd could be busy, but if you are 2-3 spaces away you don't hear the road much. Clean bathrooms, friendly staff.

We are testing out our new little RV, so wanted something close to home. Staff was helpful when my husband needed a part for our sewer hook-up. They have nice fake lawn next to most sites with brand new picnic tables and umbrellas. Nice laundry area, they even have a little rec room. I did not check out the bathrooms as we have our own. Pool looks nice. Only down side is the WiFi was really bad at our site and I wanted to work, but I have my own mobile hot spot that worked fine, so I was OK. We would go back.

We love the RV park.  It is clean, nice grounds, great pool, BBQ area, and fire pit. View the fireworks every night!  Dogs are welcome and loved! We will be staying there every time we visit Disney! Thank you!

We booked 5 nights for our family vacation to Disneyland this year. We pulled in after there office hours the first night, they had our info taped to the door with our spot number. It was easy to find and easy to get in which can be tough at times with the size of our trailer. The roving security even stopped by to make sure we good and all set up. The park is clean well set up and very quiet given where it is. The pool is on the small side but did not stop our kids from enjoying and meeting new friends. Common areas and BBQ's are very nice. It's about a mile walk to Disneyland which was not bad, there is a shuttle but you can walk there just as fast. Did use Lyft a few time back and forth from the park which was pretty cheap also. I would highly recommend staying here and we

Great resort.  We were able to get a short notice 4 night spot at the resort at a very reasonable price cheaper than a hotel in the area.  We have also stayed at this resort 5-6 times prior and we get the same service every time.  The sites are big enough for my fifth wheel and everything is there ready to go.  If yo cannot make it prior to the office closing don't worry an envelop will be hanging on the office door with your registration in it.  We will always come back to this resort when we travel to Anaheim.

Accommodates 2 tent sites as well as traditional RVs.  Great place, close to Disneyland.  Easy walk to the gates or inexpensive bus will drop you at the gate.  Showers, nice sitting area and morning coffee available.

We were very pleased! The staff was very helpful and really nice. The park is really clean and well kept up. We were really pleased with the close proximity to Disneyland. It was just a short walk. Loved it.

This is now our second August staying at this campground and we will definitely be coming back again next year. There is literally no way to be closer to Disneyland while camping. From campsite to front entrance of Disneyland it is a 12 minute walk. There is a small pool which is rarely busy, decent bathrooms ( although the shower heads are meant for someone 5'2" or shorter so bring a stool if you are tall ) There are 2 separate areas with tables and BBQ's and fire pits that are free to be used by anyone, nice laundry and there are even a few tenting spots. The only negatives are that the wifi almost never works. We have been told it is due to there being so many RV's blocking the signal but the wifi doesn't even work in the same building as the modem, and then this year we ran

We are so glad to have found this place. It is so close to Disneyland, we were able to ride our bikes to the park. We could see the fireworks from the RV park. Their permanent resident dogsitted our chocolate lab which we appreciated very much. The park, swimming pool and laundry mat were all clean, (laundry is $2 per wash and dry). Service was great. We will definitely be coming back. Thank you!

Summary Heading: Excellent place to stay while going to Disneyland
Summary: My family and I stayed at this RV park for a week for a family trip to Disneyland and a business conference. We weren't expecting much more than an asphalt parking lot in the middle of the city, but were pleasantly surprised with the service and amenities offered at this location.  It is close enough to walk to Disneyland if you want to save the parking fee.  Wifi, clean hot showers, laundry facilities and ice for sale all helped make our visit more convenient and affordable.  We had some issues getting in to the right spot because we arrived after the check in time and had some misunderstandings, but the issues were quickly resolved in a courteous and professional manner by Wendy.  The "grass" site with picnic table was a nice upgrade and it was also neat to be able to watch

Summary Heading: Time Spent at Anaheim Harbor RV Park
Summary: Park is very clean. The Staff are very friendly and knowledgeable. I was somewhat surprised that the up graded site was no more than an additional spot to park my vehicle.  The spaces are close together and just long enough to park my 38' fifth wheel. The Pool was clean as well as the restrooms.

Very courteous staff. There are only two tent sights and while they are small and close together, the sites were clean, shady and smooth. The common areas are well kept and inviting. Bathroom/showers very clean. Close to Disneyland so you can see the fireworks.

The park itself is nice and close to Disneyland..The staff were friendly and helpful..One thing I didn't care for was seeing two different individuals walking their dogs,the dogs both went to the bathroom and the owners failed to pick up after them,and one of them was a Great Dane...There are nice grassy areas between some of the RV spaces and as a guest I don't really care to step in somebody else's dog crap..

Summary Heading: Got charged even though no vacancies
Summary: Found this place on line, rang during office hours and got a messagebank, left message, no reply. Went online and filled out enquiry form for site booking, had to include my crefit card details, got confirmation. Turned up at park to be told there were no vacancies and no options were offered. Ended up trawling the streets looking for a motel that had parking available for the 32 foot RV we had intended to stay in at Anaheim Harbor RV park.  The next day I see that the RV park has charged the $20 booking fee to my card!  Sent them an email and was repeatedly told the charge was not made,  then today got told they were reversing the charge, that they had said was not made......  Then got told I should have phoned them to make the booking....  if they answered their damn phones I

Obviously, the best thing about this park is how close it is to Disneyland.  I wouldn't recommend staying here if you're just looking to go camping!  The shuttle picks up right outside the RV park, or you actually could walk depending on how old, ahem, whiny, your kids are.  There was artificial grass at our site, which I really liked--nothing to get tracked in the camper.  The bathrooms were so-so, laundry was large, but seemed pretty busy most of the time and not always open.  If you leave early and get back late because you're at Disney all day, it can be challenging getting in there to do laundry if needed.  A small pool was adequate when my kids wanted to swim.  The only thing I really didn't like was how close we were to the VERY busy street, but being in the middle of a

The staff is very nice, and the park was accommodating to our 2 vehicles.  It is quiet and clean.  No frills RV Park, but who needs to many frills when you will be spending most of your time over at Disneyland.  The shuttle picks you up and drops you off so there is no need to walk to Disneyland.  They do have a nice pool and a small laundry room.  We have stayed there 3 times and it is the cheapest prices RV Park near Disneyland.  We have made it our regular park for all our visits.

Super clean. Very nice staff. I made reservations weeks in advance and added a day a few weeks later. They got everything right and were really helpful. Enjoyed the easy access to Disney. Even though it is less than a mile from Disney, we took an UBER each way daily. Less than 6 bucks. UBER met us right there within 4 minutes each day. Bathrooms are clean. Even thought we didn't use them, the BBQ areas and pool looked fantastic. Loved our artificial grass spot. We didn't go there to "camp" . . . we used it as a spot to park and sleep. I wouldn't pick it as a destination but I don't think that's the point. I will stay here again in a heartbeat when going back to Disney.

this place was perfect for our intentions; a place to stay while visiting Disney. No, it's not a destination itself. I wouldn't travel to stay here. But, that being said, It's sparkling clean, the staff in the front office was professional, courteous and helpful. The pool was very relaxing after a day on my feet. And it is just a few steps away from great transportation.

Awesome customer service, clean sites, nice tables and artificial grass at each site! clean restrooms and swimming pool!!!! Very nice BBQ/Common area for meals, birthdays, or just sitting around the fire. i will be returning with the family for more adventures!!

I am a truck driver and stay here often. The staff and park are wonderful! The girls in the office always go the extra mile to met my needs. The price is very reasonable. Close to food and shopping. The park is very clean. I always stay here when I am in town.

Pros: The people who work there are very courteous and responded promptly to emails.  I had no problem at all when I had to change dates and wasn't charged an extra fee.  Also liked the code to enter the bathrooms at any hour.  Pool looks nice.  Cons: #1: The traffic noise was HORRIBLE.  We didn't get much sleep.  The spots nearest the road should be deeply discounted and people should be warned if they are assigned these spots so they can prepare.  #2: We were given a double spot for our little pop-up tent trailer and charged double.  Seems unfair to pay double the rate of the big rigs who probably use up a lot more resources.  #3: Nobody told us when we checked in we would need to ask for a pool key.  This information was also not on the papers we were given or on any signs
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words about our staff, we pride ourselves in our customer service. I apologize for the negative aspects of your experience that you listed and will try to address them all:  #1: The spots closest to Harbor blvd can indeed get loud at times and we usually let our guests know this ahead of time. I apologize you were not informed at the time of your booking. We are currently growing our hedges at the entrance to provide as much of a buffer from the road as possible. If being so close to Disneyland has one drawback it is how busy the roads can get.   #2: When guest check in with us we go over how many sites they were given and why. If you were given two sites it was most likely that both the trailer and the pull vehicle would not fit into the same site. As for the cost, the additional site for the pull vehicle is $6 per night. We let our guests know it is a prorated system and they are not being charged the same amount for each site given but I apologize if we didn't cover this with you.    #3: It is the city code that the pool must be locked at all times and require a key to ensure the safety of all the children at the park. We will however make it more known to the guests that they must ask for a key at the office.   #4: While we do have a fifth shower in the handicapped bathroom that we allow patrons to use, your comment about asking guests to try to limit their shower time will definitely be taken into consideration. We have been looking into remodeling our bathrooms and your other suggestions have also been sincerely noted.   Thank you for taking the time to thoughtfully review your experience at Anaheim Harbor RV Park. I am sorry that it was not a completely positive stay but please know that your criticisms are not taken lightly as we are always looking to improve our guest's experiences. Have a wonderful day!

Summary: 3 nights spent whilst visiting nearby Disney. You could walk but much better to get the shuttle bus, especially with children. The pool was a great bonus and warm. Great value for money, a friendly welcome and a superb location for Disney parks.

An average RV park that has friendly staff, clean bathrooms and close to everything including Disney Parks.   The unusual thing about the RV spaces near Ball Road, is the septic hookup location is up hill from the RV and impossible to drain properly and safely.  All in all - a nice place.

We stayed at this RV resort for a night..  the first thing I noticed is how nice the girls in the office were! The place is so close to the park!  If you want a clean nice place to stay. This is it! It is surrounded by food places and hotels.  I would stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review! We pride ourselves in our customer service so it is always wonderful to hear positive feedback about our office staff. We hope to host you again!

Summary: We stayed at the RV park last week for three nights and chose it for its proximity to Disneyland. We have a pop up camper van and were able to park in a small spot close to the pool - with our AAA discount, only ~ $30/night. The amenities were very clean - bathrooms & showers & salt water pool - and staff were friendly and helpful. There are many options to get to Disney - driving, city bus, Anaheim Resort bus, regular taxi, Uber, walking. We have 2 kids (10 & 7) and chose to use Uber (only $5-7) to get us there each day. In the evenings, we walked back - only took about 15-20 minutes. We left early in the am and got back after dinnertime, so weren't at the RV park except to sleep. The only complaint, and some may see this as a 'plus' is the Disney fireworks were extremely loud

First time here and the staff was great.   Spaces are a little tight but not really a problem, as we spent little time in RV.  Pool is great.  Will be back.  Bus to Disney close to park and it is walkable.

This RV Park is very close to Disneyland.  There is a shuttle to and from a bus stop very near.  You can purchase shuttle tickets in the office.  The office staff was very friendly and helpful.  Our site was large enough and had full hookups.

This RV park is good not far at all from Disneyland that's why we chose it nice area this is are first stay there the only complaint I have is that other people that stay there that have dogs with them should learn to pick up their dropping after their dogs do their thing we had an artificial tuff area next to us that had droppings in it and was not even picked up so that's my complaint if the people who own then can't pick it up the staff should be on their toes to do so but other then that it was nice place to stay with our travel trailer.

Summary Heading: The Only Place for RVers Near Disneyland
Summary: We have stayed here three times in the last few months. Please know that this is not a resort. It is a comfortable, safe place to stay when wanting to be near Disneyland and the Anaheim area. It is very walkable. The staff is amazingly helpful. If you are going to arrive late, let them know and you will be well cared for. We will be back!

We spent 4 nights in February of 2017. The staff was super friendly and even addressed me as Mr. (you don't hear that often anymore). We didn't realize how close we were to Disneyland and were anticipating huge parking fees and a shuttle ride to the front gates. However, we were able to walk there in about 15 minutes with ease. The RV park was very, very neat and tidy also.

This place is about as close to Disneyland as you can get for the money. My wife and I were here for 4 nights to visit Disneyland, California Adventure Park and Universal Studios (hour drive). It's a concrete jungle, which initially I didn't like (we are from Canada and used to being surrounded by nature). However, the warm weather, easy walking distance to Disney, and close proximity to Camp Bow Wow for our dog Champ made this perfect. We were really on there to sleep and eat breakfast but WIFI was good, didn't use the showers. Be aware of laundry mat hours. Minor inconvenience that caught us off guard but not a problem. Also, the sewer connection was quite a stretch from the drain point on my trailer. I had to buy another hose which is the only reason I knocked a point off

Summary Heading: So this place has some problems. ..
Summary: It's taken me months to calm down enough to review this place. We showed up at 525pm to find the office closed and no bathroom keys left for us. We have a tent trailer and two small children.  So a bathroom is vital. Be sure you have cash because both bathroom and pool have cash key deposits, nevermind that we had a cc on file. The office closes early and security doesn't come on till 9pm. So at 7, when you take your small children to the bathroom and find a mentally ill woman sitting on the bathroom counter, screaming at herself in the mirror it sort of freaks everyone out. The phone number to after hours staff never picked up. I will say the staff had grace in these tough situations when I spoke to them. We definitely had the best site. It was across from the pool, away from

Helpful friendly staff.  Close to Disneyland , transportation to and from Disneyland is close by.  Restaurants close by.  Nice showers. Great laundry facility.   Pool is nice we have used it on past visits, however was closed the days we stayed there as the weather was a bit cool but with that said we are Canadians and used to the colder water so that would of been nice for the kids to swim. Grounds are kept clean and security at night is around.  Felt safe there.  Was a great visit!

Walkable to Disneyland if no disability. There is a shuttle service available but kink of expensive. Very easy on/off the freeway and gas nearby. Only saw two restaurants close and both Italian (pizzeria and a casual dining). Nice park and actually pretty quiet considering right on busy streets. Somewhat disappointed in shower facilities. The only one's our code would access were very small. The men's wasn't heated, so the shower was really fast! Neither men's or women's had any place to set dry clothing that wasn't on the floor or 1 hook IN the shower.

Very easy to find and in great location for access to Disneyland with buses departing frequently just outside the park. Toilets and showers were ok. Easy to park the RV. Nice pool area. Generally a very nice park, clean and tidy.

This was our first stay here and will not be our last. I recommend to anyone travelling thru or visiting the local amusement parks to stop in here. Very clean park, less than a mile from the Disney parks, Pizza place right next door and ART stop less than a block away. You can also buy your ART passes at the office. The office staff is great, very knowledgeable and gave us the info we needed for using the ART system. We even saw some of the office staff out walking the property taking notes and making sure everything was right. Nice touch!

We stayed here in June 2016. we stayed in a RV. The sites are concrete and close but you cant get any closer to Disneyland. We watched the fireworks right from our site every night and walked to Disneyland every day. The price was reasonable as well

Summary Heading: Convenient location close to the park.
Summary: We have been coming to Anaheim Harbor since we first bought or trailer years ago. It is such an amazing park. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The amenities were clean. Very reasonable price, given the location. You have restaurants in various locations close to the facility, so there are plenty of options. Very close to Disney, if you don't mind walking a little to get there. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone and we look forward to our next Disneyland weekend.

Great location, clean campground. Pool was very nice. Showers were hot. We had a spot next to the putting green and arcade; it was perfect for our kids. Very close walk to Disney, .7 of a mile. Office staff was very friendly and helpful. I gave a 4 star bc the bathrooms could use some attention. They were frequently used by campers and could use more frequent cleaning or more available restrooms.  I would stay again!

This was the first time we stayed here and loved it! The place was clean, and staff was friendly and helpful. We will stay there again! It was close and walking distance to Disneyland. The view of the fireworks was great!

Amenities were clean - shower and toilet stalls extremely tiny - no shelf in shower stall to place your things - only a hook. Pool looked great but had the full sun on it most of the day with no shade.  Was not impressed by the ignorant new arrival at 2am who decided getting his RV into his site required his headlights on full beam shining into our van.

Anaheim Harbor Rv Park was a great experience for our stay. We were walking distance from Disneyland. The RV park is very dog friendly. The WiFi was good.  I would recommend this place and will be back in the future.

We have stayed here before and it's a great place to stay when going to disneyland.  We arrived after hours and the security guard helped us out.  We had a great spot with grass next to us.  We definitely will stay here again...

Well first I have to say this RV park is in the perfect location for Disneyland. We rode our bikes back and forth to the park as there is a bike rack on Harbor Blvd near where the shuttles go in and out. I wouldn't recommend it for children, as the road is busy with traffic.  I rode on the sidewalk (yes i know its illegal) but its better than getting hit by a car on that busy road. You could walk i would say it may take 15-20 min or so. Also, I was told there is a ART shuttle you can take for a cheap price, but we didn't do it.  We could also see the fireworks in the RV park right from our site. Since it is the off season, they only have fireworks on weekends. Showers clean at the park, not much water pressure.  You should pay the little extra for an upgraded site with turf.  It

This was our first time using Anaheim Harbor RV park. Overall it was a great experience, we arrived late after the office was closed were helped by the security guard with locating our space. Was surprised by how quite the park was at night even with its close proximity to Harbor Blvd, the only real noise were the fireworks from Disneyland but we expected that from reading other reviews. The staff in the office was very friendly and helpful. It was an easy walk to the Disneyland resorts. We will definitely stay there again when we go to Disneyland next time.

Summary Heading: Perfect for a familly Disney vacation on a budget
Summary: It is just down the road from Disneyland. Yes you can walk it but after a full day in the park you probably won't want to.  We got dropped off by hubby (there are 6 of us) then he would drive back to the RV park (literally a 2 minute drive) and catch the ART back up. Saved us money so all of us didn't have to pay.  We had sites 136 and 138 with an AstroTurf lawn, picnic table and umbrella right across from the pool.  It was perfect. We went at park opening and came back each day about 2.  Kids would swim, we cooked a meal then went back in the evening.  On our non Disney days we had a perfect view from our site of the fireworks. We sat in our lawn chairs and watched them right over the pool.  It was like they put them on just for us, they are so close.  If you plan on spending

This place is super close to Disneyland. We've been here twice because it's far enough from LA and driving to the San Diego area is not too bad.   The site is clean, monitored, and quiet. There are monthly renters, but they are located near the back.   Just like any public place, make sure you take care of any valuable items. We had one of our bikes stolen, but my fault - didn't lock them up.   I highly recommend this place. Great view of the daily fireworks.

We enjoy staying here. Always very clean well maintained and Sheyanne always is friendly and remembers us which I appreciate. Sites are a perfect size and the pool is always very clean. They have helpful security for late check in when the office is closed. Always a awesome place to stay. I like site 189 because I can see the Disneyland fireworks show from inside the rv.

Summary Heading: A Great RV Park That's Close to Disney!
Summary: We had a great stay!  A 15 minute walk to Disney, very helpful and accomodating staff, large double site for our 36ft (one half of the double had artificial turf and a picnic table with umbrella for hot sunny days).  The staff even helped us out with an extra spot for our rental car.  Nightly Disney fireworks could be easily enjoyed from our picnic table.  Would not hesitate to stay there again.

We have stayed here many times over the years . Staff are extremely friendly . Park is well maintained. Staff make every effort to make our stay wonderful. We walk to Disneyland about 20 mins .The pool furniture has been updated looks real nice with many umbrellas. The bathroom would benefit with a remodel only 2 showers small area with inadequate ventilation. We love it here and highly recommend.Its a short drive Knottsberry Farm this makes it nice to take a day off from Disneyland. Knottsberry also has a water slide Park separated from the Slide Park.

Anahiem Harbor RV Park is conveniently located about 1/2 mile (1400 steps for me) from the Disneyland Resorts. The staff were friendly and helpful. I was interested in using a shuttle service for transportation to and from Disneyland and around Anahiem, the staff directed me to the ART ( Anaheim Resort Translation) kiosk at the Ménage Hotel (on the corner of Harbor and Ball).   The parking is on asphalt with a patch of green AstroTurf, picnic table and umbrella. The spaces are close but allocation for parking a tow vehicle is given.   Laundry room is clean and inexpensive! Actually, the prices are the cheapest I have ever seen, $1 to wash and $1 for 45 minutes of drying!  Great place to stay while visiting the SoCal attractions!

Staff was nice. For 4th of July they invited everyone at the park for a picnic on the premises. The price was right and the location, fantastic. We stayed for a week.   There are permanent residents on location. Felt a little uneasy about one of them.  Watch your kids at the pool side. The RV park does have a night patrol. We felt very safe.

We were only there one night but liked it! It was super clean and nice! The staff were helpful and friendly! Clean laundry facilities. Grassy area for our dog was well kept. The pool was being worked on so we didn't use it. The proximity to Disneyland was amazing! We would definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Great location, great people, easy access to Disney
Summary: The park was clean, the people were friendly, the staff was great.  We parked a forty foot Berkshire for two nights.  Electrical, waste, cable all easy peezy.  Their restrooms and showers were clean and accessible.  They have a putting green and arcade as well.  The pool was out of service but they called us ahead to let us know so frankly we werent disappointed by that; the call was a very nice touch.  Would stay here again with out a doubt.

Summary Heading: Great place to park your rig.
Summary: Great place to park your rig while visiting Disneyland and other area attractions. Perfectly located and very affordable compared to other local campgrounds. Isles are wide allowing for easy back in parking. The grounds are clean and well kept. They have night security who have been very helpful when arriving after hours. Couple things to note, that some may consider a negative. There is no playground or large grass area for kids to play. There are only a few spaces with artificial grass the rest are pretty much side by side parking spaces. We don't see this as a negative because we are just there to sleep.

We have not stayed there yet, but have visited the property in the past to scope it out. We wanted to recognize the wonderful service and pleasantness of Sheyanne who took our reservation.  She was very helpful, responsive and quick. Sheyanne also assisted us with a reservation change very expediently. We look forward to staying even more due to this great first impressioin.

Summary Heading: Meh...ok, but Wifi didn't reach my trailer
Summary: Meh...The park was clean. The staff was friendly, not helpful, but courteous. I got in late and they had assigned me a space by the noisy arcade building, next to a putting green, and across from the bathrooms. First, I have no idea how they expected me to get in that spot. Second, I had two dogs with me and they would've been going nuts next to all that noise and foot traffic. Bobby, the Security guy was super-helpful and showed me a different spot right at the road up front...SUPER-NOISY street. The staff, the next morning, said I could only stay in that space for 2 nights, but would have to move to a different space for the third night...RIGHT NEXT to another trailer, when ALL the other spaces were open. Ok. Did that. Of course, the space I was in for two nights didn't fill.

Even though there was a shuttle from the RV park to Disney, we chose one day to just take the 1/2 mile walk to the Entrance. Very easy walk.   As for the park, it was indeed clean and appealing.  However:  It seemed odd to us that first, you had to put a deposit down for a bathroom key, then remember the key each time you went to the bathroom, then return the key during business hours if you wanted your deposit back before you departed. Why not just install the use of a keyless lock system with a code?? That's what Im used to at most other parks. Keys are just a mess! And keeping track of the deposits???  A nightmare!   Secondly, cleaning time for the bathrooms seems to come right when most people are wanting to take a shower. The paper work says "...cleaning will take place

Upon arrival I was impressed with the upkeep of this park. The bathrooms were a great size, the space was nice and we were lucky enough to get one of the spaces with grass and picnic table. It was close to Disneyland which was nice because they also offered a shuttle at an affordable price. In regards to the customer service though; I would almost think twice about coming back. The manager Christina was anything but pleasant. She kept her back to me every single time I came in the office but Shiane and Amy were very pleasant. They seemed to be the only people in the office that I came across that cared about making me and my family feel welcome. Kim walked around in the evening and genunianly cared about asking how our stay was. If you can avoid Christina please do so because

We just completed our trip to Anaheim and I wanted to share my experience with the Harbor RV Park.   We read many of the reviews previously posted and I want to share that our experience was 5 star worthy from the time we booked the trip until the time we left. The office staff was kind and accommodating to our trip needs in advance of our arrival.  They even called me back to confirm our spot number request 3 days before our arrival. We arrived late at night after the office was closed and the paperwork was all prepared and all we had to do was pull in and go to sleep. We ran to Disneyland early the next morning and didn't even have time to check in and pay for our stay.  When we got back late that night we had a friendly note on our door welcoming us to the park. We finally

The staff, the facilities and the long-term residents are very helpful and friendly.  They take a real interest in making your stay a great experience.  We look forward to our next stay.  The directions are very helpful on the website.  The staff are ever present and able to answer any questions.  We couldn't ask for more.

Summary Heading: Disneys california wine and food festival home base
Summary: great staff, very helpful. security greeted us as we pulled in late and helped us into our spot. front office helped with getting us a great taxi ride to park and just very nice in general. Every thing very clean.

Anaheim Harbor is a very nice park. The location is perfect for the theme parks, restaurants and other attractions. All back in spots but they allow 2 spots if you have a tow vehicle. Consequently you have lots of room😀. Well maintained grounds, small warm pool and friendly staff.  Be aware however, because of its very close proximity to Disneyland their nightly fireworks display is beautiful but loud. We would return if we are again if we are in the area.

Good RV park. Easy in/out. Good value and close to Disneyland. Watched the fireworks from our picnic table. Right off highway 5. Nice having "grass" option for buffer space. Very helpful and friendly staff. Walk to restaurants and shuttle bus.

Summary Heading: This was a very clean and quiet RV Park within a short distance to Disneyland!
Summary: We found this park to be well-situated to Disneyland....about a mile walk on the sidewalk.  If you don't like to walk, there is a public shuttle stop about a block away.  There were some restaurants very close to the RV Park too...which is nice.  I was expecting more traffic noise....there was just a general hum of traffic, but no loud vehicle sounds.  We really liked how clean it was too.   We walked home really late at night and felt very safe.

Anaheim Harbor RV Park was exactly what we needed, very close to Disneyland, used the ART shuttle to and from Disneyland (although we could have walked). Even had a great view of the Disneyland fireworks at 9:15pm from our RV. Clean park, friendly office staff, easy in and out, just a block off the I-5 freeway. Remember that the utility hookups are at the rear of the space, used my five foot extension hose. We will return. Thanks

Needed something in a hurry, Kim was awesome helping us out. Sam, Kim, and Sheyonne were there to give us a warm welcome. Fantastic spot close to everything we needed: theme parks, food, shopping, and easy freeway access.    Thank you very much!

Anaheim Harbor RV park is the closest RV park to Disneyland.  We were quite comfortable with the deluxe site with grass.  It held our 27' trailer, towing truck and extra car.  You can watch the Disneyland fireworks from the campground.  Make sure you bring a sewer hose, fresh water hose and electrical cord to reach 2-3' farther than the back of your RV/trailer.  All the hook ups are at the back of the sites not on the side between sites.

Summary Heading: Very pleased with our stay, highly recommend the RV park.
Summary: This RV park is within easy walking distance to Disneyland, local bus service is also available at reasonable cost. The check-in process was excellent and exceeded expectations.  The employees were very helpful, efficient, and provided good information regarding the amenities of the surrounding area. I had expected to store our trailer in some back lot, however, I was assigned the space adjacent to the RV for storage.  It could not have been more convenient. All services offered were excellent, all hook-ups functioned as expected, and the site assigned was very convenient for backing both the trailer and coach into the space. The park is located reasonably close to shopping, fuel, and the interstates to surrounding areas. All facilities were very clean. The WiFi was better than

Summary Heading: A great place to stay for a visit ti Disneyland
Summary: Site was clean and in excellent condition - we had plenty of room and the facilities are clean as well. The folks at the office are very friendly and polite, and helpful, too. The help we received when we arrived (after 10:00 pm) was extraordinary. Shah helped us get to the correct site, and kept a light on while I unhooked and got settled in. We felt very welcome and comfortable. We have stayed there a number of times in the past and have always had great service.

They are the closets RV park to Disneyland.  The park and it's amenities are very well-kept, and it's easy access to the Interstate.  The management team was professional, helpful and friendly.  This park is a real gem.

Our stay was fantastic. The facilities are very clean. We had 4 spaces they were able to park us next to each other. Camping sights are large with Astroturf lounging area equipped with picnic table and umbrella. It is not a bad walk to Disneyland. Office staff was friendly and helpful. The park is patrolled by security we felt very safe and did not worry about our RV when we were not there. It is a very quiet park for being in the middle of Anaheim. Two complaints I have would not keep us from coming back again one showers need a bench in them for your belongings to stay dry and second  for us the laundry room hours where not convenient if they could have a key the same as the bathrooms that would be great. All units were working and very reasonably priced.

Summary Heading: CLEAN FRIENDLY PARK VERY CLOSE TO DISNEY RESORTS
Summary: First of all, they advertise this park as the closest RV park to Disneyland.  That is absolutely true.  This park is really close.  More importantly, since Disney Corporation acquired and leveled the RV park across the street Anaheim Harbor RV Park, this is one of the few remaining RV parks in the area.  If you're going to Disneyland, grab ART right next door and ride in comfort to the park.  I bought a multi day pass for my stay.  I had to go down to the Melange Hotel for the pass but it was close and easy to acquire.  This park is really clean, the individual spaces are wide and all the facilities are well maintained.  The staff was very friendly, helpful and courteous.  And, costs are very affordable.  And, finally, every night I slept in my own bed, no maid service banging

Beautiful clean park, reasonable cost, staff was very accommodating, shuttle bus to Disneyland very close by and tickets can be purchased inside their office. Our 3 night stay was great and would not hesitate to recommend this place to friends or stay there again.

We drove from Vancouver, BC to Aneheim to visit Disney over 3 days.  Our group consisted of 3 adults and 5 teenagers (ages 16 to 19).  We found the staff very friendly and accommodating.  We were beside the tiny putting green.  It was very close to our site and I can see that being a problem if other people wanted to use it, but, since it was unseasonably cold during our visit, it felt like our own private lawn.  The bathrooms were clean and the showers hot.  Best of all was the short walk to Disneyland and being able to watch the fireworks without the ridiculous crowds.

Harbor RV Park was very clean. The facilities were well kept and the location was ideal for our family trip. The bus was just down the street and getting to and from the RV Park was very easy. The showers were great; clean and very hot water.  The staff was helpful and nice.  If we ever head back to Anaheim, we will stay here.

At first I was worried based on all the negative reviews here, but we booked it anyway. We were SHOCKED at how nice this place is! The service was great, the park was extremely clean and SAFE. No concerns about leaving our things in our tent, we were close to the restrooms, which were impeccable! All the people there were very nice, and it was very close to Disneyland Park. We walked and rode the ART (which goes every 20 minutes and is $5 per day). We will for sure stay again! Don't listen to other people's negative reviews, give this place a chance! They are worth it!

We are returning guests stayed here 4 days this time. Great place to stay for a visit to Disneyland, Safe , Quiet , Clean , and easy to get to. We will be looking forward to our next stay Thanks to all the Staff for everything they do.

The location was in walking distance to park (12min walk) and shuttle for fee is an option. Park is clean, and bathrooms well maintained and nice. Great view of the fire works. Pool warm and ok. Con's: Sites are too crammed together, our site backed up to a very ghetto motel/apartment and our back was almost in reaching distance to their windows. Putting green is a joke about the size of a car, in a corner right on someone else's site practically. Office staff made a huge deal about us staying 45min over check out even though we asked prior. 1/2 sites are very close to main street and cars are noisy.

Summary Heading: Perfect if you're walking to Disney
Summary: The basics:  Plenty of large motorhomes and 5th wheels fit fine, 30 amp and 50 amp available, all hook ups worked well.  Wifi is free but too slow to be functional, even with a booster on the top of our motorhome. Spaces are close together - request a spot with "grass" (artificial turf) and a picnic table next door to give yourself some space.  Road noise on Harbor Blvd is significant, ask for a spot as far back from the street as possible.  Pool was heated, clean.  We've stayed at the other RV park in Anaheim for a trip to Disney before and we almost did again after reading some of these reviews.  But we brought our dog and wanted to be able to walk him to/from Disney (he stayed in the Disney Kennel.  We walked him every 2.5-3 hours, the kennels are clean and temp. controlled

A note of thanks from Jeanine.  We stayed here at the RV park to visit Disneyland and other surrounding areas of interest.  The park is very convenient for this reason and a short walk away from Disneyland.  The Office management is very friendly, helpful, and accomodating.  We also had to leave very early on the day of our departure so we were unable to return our restroom key to receive our deposit back when the office was open.  So, just by chance, I left a note with the key in the door slot and asked the management to return our deposit ($5) by mail.  To my surprise, I received a very nice letter thanking us for our stay with our $5 included.  They are especially very dog friendly.  The RV sites are exceptionally clean as are the restrooms.  My only suggestion is to have a

After reading reviews I was a bit worried about our stay here, but Disneyland's expensive and financially this fit the budget. Veteran rate was a plus! Honestly I can't understand why anyone would complain it's such a close walk to Disneyland literally over the freeway pass and you're there. It's super clean I saw the owner every morning maintaining the grounds. The night we came in late I was worried we wouldn't locate the office or our spot, well we were greeted by the kindest security guard who assisted us with the entire process. And guided us into our spot. Yes the spots are hard to get into, but for an experienced driver it's cake 😉 pool and rest rooms very clean! Best part this park has front row seats to fireworks every night!!!  You get two spaces one for you're rig

There are a lot of full time people there.  The pool is small, no playground and not much of a walking area for pets.  Harbor boulevard is right there, the shuttle is a short walk but they couldn't give us a timetable.  We did have a good view of  the the fireworks at night.  And we also were able to get in at the last few days during a busy time.

Anaheim Harbor RV park in Anaheim Ca.  we step out of our RV by a little house in the center of the complex opening the door we see...... Sheyenne the assistant manager and Kristina the park manager very nice girls. Sheyenne the sassy one and Kristina the nice one.... Greet us with open arms and very pleasant personality so much that we brought our dog inside the office... and the girls just fell in love with him........ the girls are very pleasant and accommodating and getting us to stay for two days instead of just one.... helping us very much I would recommend this place to anybody ...that is coming in out of town couples or entire family... being that it is just a short walk away from Disneyland...... Anaheim Harbor RV Park accommodate from 1 to 2 days up to 30 days as

My family stayed there one week (9-25 to 10-2-2015) to visit Disneyland. The staff was super nice and very helpful. The bathrooms and showers are very very clean. The swimming pool was very nice. The whole RV park is very well kept!  Definitely coming back in Jan.2016.                                                             Chadwick S.

My wife and a I stayed here for 3 days in August.  The staff were friendly and helpful, the park was neat and clean and the location to the ARK shuttle couldn't be beat.  The sites are small but that really isn't a problem since really the reason for being there is Disneyland and not hanging around in the park. The nightly fireworks from Disneyland are literally right over your head at night time.   They have what looked like a very nice pool.  We didn't use it but it seemed popular and well maintained.  There is no doubt that next time we are passing through in our 5th wheel we will be staying here.

Park was okay. Not easy to find office. Very tight for our 5th wheel. Had the things we needed: electric, water, sewer. Don't believe we would stay here again. This is on a busy street and the sign was hard to see to find the park. The pool was really small. We did not use any other facilities so cannot not speak to laundry. Quite a few permanent residences in this park.

Looks good when you arrive for a paved city park but the place gets scanned by thieves who come back with what they need to steal your stuff no matter how well locked up you have it. Even with a "security guard" on "duty".... He "claims" he saw nothing....our expensive bikes were stolen from the back of our truck by very prepared thugs in the middle of the night. These bikes were cable locked several times and ratchet tie downed. It would have been one thing if our stuff wasn't so locked up but obviously, NOTHING is safe here. We heard the racket and were able to stop them in time to save only one bike. The staff was lukewarm about it and didn't even offer to look at security tapes only noting that OUR trailer was out of the camera line of site. We did not feel safe at this park

Summary Heading: Nice park, customer service is not
Summary: If I could have gotten reservations I would have stayed at Anaheim Resort RV Park,  the park here is good and average.  The employees should not just be there to collect the money,  no cable and WiFi is poor, it's good for the money. Maybe they will up there customer service as they have done with the park. 1 to 10 scale, 10 being best it's a 7. It's very close to Disneyland, so it gets a better score. Smiles are free and they should give out more. :)
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We apologize for your customer service experience. We take all critiques to heart as we are always trying to improve our business. We hope to host you again!

Summary: Worst place I've ever stayed. The front desk has zero customer service skills and are SO rude. I can't recall a time that I've been treated so poorly.  The grounds have a smell of trash and urine every where you walk. The play ground in the photos has been removed and replaced with a small section of plain grass that is covered in dog feces.  We had some pool item stollen from in front of our rv.  When we arrived we took one circle around the park which should have been our first hint to leave. The place is so run down and gross. The second night there were homeless people sleeping by the bathrooms and broken glass by the pool. Do your self a favor and skip this place.
Manager Response: As a family owned business, we are saddened that you did not have a good experience at our park. We take your comments very seriously, and, with that in mind, we need more information about when you stayed at the park and with whom you dealt with in the park office. None of the park office personnel recognize your name and certainly, no one remembers dealing with someone as unhappy as you were/are.  We do not have homeless people staying at the park and never had.  Perhaps you mean the people who were staying in the tent sites? Both of our tent sites, which are located near the restrooms, have been full for the month of July.  We have an outside security service that routinely patrols the park and they would definitely have reported seeing homeless people. We also have security cameras so perhaps if you will tell us which space you occupied, we can review the security cameras also. We apologize that the playground photo was still shown on the site - we just recently replaced the playground with grass, picnic tables, umbrellas and a BBQ - the photo was removed from our website but wasn’t removed from TripAdvisor.  That was an oversight that has since been corrected.  Our maintenance personnel are very competent so your comments are definitely not representative of what we strive to maintain.  Many guests compliment us on our cleanliness so we are dismayed by your experience.  Thank you for your kind attention.

Summary: This park was nice clean and close to the park. Since I have a longer travel trailer I was also given the spot next to mine to park my SUV. The restrooms were clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again and I recommend this park to others.

This park advertises that they can accomodate 40 ft rigs.  The spaces can accomodate those rigs but the main aisle cannot.  We have a 35' rig and was towing a car, even with taking the car off, trying to get around to park was difficult.  Would not recommend this park for rigs over 20-25'.  The noise on the street did not stop all night, so we did not get a good nights sleep.  We will not be staying there again.

Summary Heading: Great affordable RV camping close to Disneyland!
Summary: We stayed here for four nights while going to Disneyland and knots berry farm and loved it! We are new to RV camping so I have to say a was a little nervous. We paid a $5 deposit (which we got back when we turned it in) to have the shower key to shower whenever we wanted which was great! We just got a pull in spot because we didn't spend a lot of time there which was perfect. Used the laundry mat before we left which was nice and clean along with the showers. We will be going again and spending more time there with maybe a bigger spot next time. Loved the place and would highly recommend it!
