we stayed at 1 of the only 2 tent sites there. this was the only drawback i have of this place. whith that being said awesome customer service. the staff answered all my questions wich were many. we stayed 2 nights and was realativity quiet and very clean. showers goodand hot. staff even assisted us on parking when we were leaving but still going to disney and helped us save the 20.00 disney parking fees. thanks.we will difently be going back.

We stayed in the only tent site for a week. Bring air mattresses as the site is brick pavers. Staff was very friendly each time I went to the office. Park was clean, washrooms were even cleaner. Close enough to Disney to see and hear the fireworks. Close to the freeway but really the noise turns into white noise after a few minutes and I didn't even notice the sounds. It is across from a school but again not noticeable. The Anaheim Marketplace is across the main street and good for browsing for anything imaginable.  Close to both Angel Stadium and the Honda center.  There should be several more tent sites made available and about 10$ less per night.

Due to unexpected circumstances, I had to cancel my trip to California and notified Samantha who was very prompt to answer, understand my issues and find a positive solution. I definitely recommend Anaheim Harbor RV and be more than happy to plan vacations with the them in the future.

We stayed here while in the LA area, and the park was great.  Easy access, level and clean sites, very friendly and helpful staff in the office.  The pool was clean and heated, but the photo is a bit misleading as to its size.  The bathroom (women's) was clean and updated, although the stalls were a bit small for changing clothes after showering.  The proximity to the Disneyland fireworks was great!  Felt like a private show every night...

Summary Heading: Three days @ Harbor RV Park, we had a nice vacation, and the park was very nice and clean throughout.
Summary: Thanks for a great time @ Harbor RV Park, very restful and clean RV park, I reccomend it to anyone in an RV visiting Disneyland, everything was easy access, and comfortable.  The staff was very helpful and courteous.

This was our first visit to the park it was nice location didn't look like the photos they put on their site not table or place to set up out door cooking - bus system was easy to use to get to races and attractions near by.  we will be staying here again

Summary Heading: Video Tour of this rv park.
Summary: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r6unWYCHSeM  I stayed there 1 night. The place has a heated pool, close to Disneyland , and fabulous wifi if you need it. The park also has Time Warner cable tv. Very clean park.

We recently stayed at the Anaheim Harbor RV Park for four nights during a quick stop to go to Disneyland. We have previously stayed at a different RV Park in the area and chose this one for its closer location. We arrived late in the evening, but our paperwork was on the office door and we pulled in to our double wide spot with green turf without any problems. We loved the extra space of having a double wide spot, and especially enjoyed the green turf area with picnic table/umbrella so we had a place for the kids to play outside and not be on concrete. Our golden retriever also enjoyed rolling around on the turf and not being on cement. I would highly recommend those sites, considering the price difference is minimal compared to the other smaller sites.  The customer service was

This was our first visit, but not our last... everthing you would want at a fair price...pool, childerns play area extra clean and quite...free wi-fi it just a great park....spent 3 days Very close to 3 or 4 different freeways and walking distance to lots of attractions  I would recommand this park and have future plans on staying there again very soon...
Manager Response: Thank you, garymc2015! We appreciate your kind words and look forward to hosting you again in the future!

Summary: This is the second time we have stayed here. Typical city RV park. But so convenient to the parks - we were in the gate 20 minutes after beginning our walk to the parks. We will definitely stay here again. Only downside was that they put us in a spot that was tough to maneuver our trailer into when there were lots of other, easier spots available.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, Jonaldo! We appreciate your return business. Sorry about the difficulties you had maneuvering into your spot, we will be sure to get you a more accommodating spot on your next visit!

Summary: Stayed 2 nights while at Disney land - very easy to find and deal with. Was no picnic table at our spot but showed back up the morning we left. Clean, very nice staff thank you to them. Would recommend to anyone taking a RV to Disneyland....it was right down the street
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we really appreciate it! We apologize that there was no picnic table at your site during your stay. We will be sure to watch out for that in the future. Hopefully we will have the pleasure of hosting you(with a picnic table) again!

Summary Heading: Full hookups, walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: Stayed Saturday October 11-12th for the CHOC walk at Disneyland. Park has full hookups, spots that are easy to pull into, and is in a great location. My kids enjoyed the arcade. We bought the $5.00 shuttle pass on Saturday night to visit Downtown Disney and walked the short mile to Disneyland the following morning. I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, Jill R! We pride ourselves in our convenient location to Disneyland, but we also enjoy being only a couple of miles up the I-5 from the Honda Center and Angel's Stadium.

Summary: I have read the reviews of other people and can't believe how negative some people are, they need to stop moaning and start living. We are at this park now for our second night, and it is great, around 15 mins walk to the parks. It is clean, the staff are great, its quiet, we have a little pool just next to the camper. Couldn't ask for more. Would definately recommend and use again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, Jill R! We pride ourselves in our convenient location to Disneyland, but we also enjoy being only a couple of miles up the I-5 from the Honda Center and Angel's Stadium.

Summary: Anaheim Harbor RV Park was perfect for our trip.  2 blocks from the main entrance of the parks, we walked very day to the park.  Safe, convenient, clean and quiet.  The park is about 2/3 monthly rentals but the front 1/3 is all daily and most probably there for their own Disney adventure.  Conveniently located on Harbor and the 5.  We were in town for the Halloween Disney adventure.

We brought our two kids to Disneyland and pulled our tent trailer with us. The price was great (about $45/night) for our trailer and the staff was very friendly. Its not a huge RV park so the bathrooms are kind of small (only 3 toilet stalls and 2 showers) in each bathroom so sometimes people had to wait to shower but I showered early so it wasn't a big deal. The showers are a bit small. They have a few general items you can purchase if you need and those prices weren't inflated like many places. It is close to Disneyland and there is a bus you can catch right by the park entrance. Overall a great stay and I'd definitely go again!

The worker in the office was rude.  He wouldn't turn off his Ozzy music when I arrived.  Was pissed I didn't have a smaller bill than a $20 for the $5 bathroom key deposit, and when I went to give the key back the day we were leaving, around 7:55 am he told me "go away, the office doesn't open until 8." This RV park is good if you are at the park all day BUT it's in a bad area, loads of homeless people walking through the park, and it's not that clean.  I will never stay here again.  Wish the other RV had not closed down, it was much nicer.

It main claim to fame is being the closest RV park to Disneyland, but the small gardens and grass areas are very well maintained and it is quiet pleasant also.  We were there when there were empty space between RVs, but I think that it would be a bit of a squeeze when fully booked.  A few spaces are adjacent to grass patches.  And the claim is true... Disneyland is a very short walk up harbor blvd.  Its not the sort of park that you would want to spend all day at, but perfect to stay at when you are not at Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great place for a great price
Summary: We pulled into Anaheim after dark and did a quick internet search on where we could park our RV.  The office was closed for the night but we were able to choose a spot, despite it being Labor Day.  In the morning my husband officially checked in and came back raving about the friendliness of the staff.  And the price!  We were on a west coast road trip and one of our stops was San Francisco, where we paid over double the price of Anaheim Harbor RV Park for way less than half the service.  Here we were even able to get a military discount!  We had only planned on staying one night, but after our long day at Disneyland and the RV park's convenience made us want to stay another night.  The website says that it is within walking distance to the parks, and it is, but it's a bit of a

Summary Heading: awesome and afforable stay so close to Disneyland
Summary: our stay was great we arrived later in the afternoon and noticed right away it was very clean and kept up. Restrooms very clean & neat, & from what we did experience it was an all around great place to stay, so close to Disneyland.  Very quiet also, considering the location.

I booked a spot with grass and picnic table and I got a spot with just pavement bathroom was dirty will not go back  I asked for different location and they were available but was told I had to wait for manager she was gone for the day this was 3:00 pm really

Summary Heading: A good place to camp near Disney's Land
Summary: It's a RV site but we tented there on an artificial turf among those RVs. It was very convenient for my niece and nephew to go to the park and could come back for cook out dinner and then went  back to the park till closing time. The place worked find for us. The extremely small restrooms and bathrooms were OK if you are average size, otherwise your knees will hit the door. The staff at the reception were extremely nice and pleasant. The free WiFi ,even though was not very strong, was also a hit with my niece and nephew.

Summary Heading: One Great week, June 28th to July 6th!!!
Summary: First, this is a RV park, not a tenting facility.  I'm sure that they had tenting in a couple of spots to be nice and try to accommodate, however, this is a RV park and the issues from tent campers are a moot point if your in a RV. National Parks are beautiful for tenting.  We had an awesome stay and a wonderful spot across from the pool.  We had plenty of space and walked to Disneyland. Everything is kept spotless and the security at night was a big plus!  When we checked in, I had already called many times because we were off schedule, I was reassured our spot would be waiting for us, the young man at the desk was very nice and helpful.  They even called while we were on the road to let us know our spot number and the best way to park !   We arrived at 2:30 am.  We were not

We booked a tent site here and ended up sleeping on pavement, then we got moved to a place near the trash, they have kids (ages 2 to 8) screaming and yelling at times when people are trying to sleep , the staff leave early so everything is locked before they close,and one bathroom for 150 people, street lights on all night next to the sites that blinds you and dogs run and pee on tents, a play ground that is also a dogs bathroom, and they triple charged also, so i recommend staying at the bug infested motel next door

I booked this RV park based on previous reviews (thank you).  This was a great location, close to Disney, clean bathrooms, arcade to entertain the kids, small park and of course the pool was a popular spot for us.  I rented a spot for a 32 foot RV and a pad with grass (astro-turf) for my dog.  The grass pad also included a picnic table w/umbrella.  Our spot was close to the restrooms (61&62).  Would recommend this location to family travelers!

Summary Heading: Good full hookup park. Not beautiful, reasonably quiet, easy Disney access.
Summary: Good full hookup park. Not beautiful, reasonably quiet, easy Disney access. We had a double parking lot space for our fifth wheel so not too close to next unit.  Lots of long term units in rear,  not pretty but no probs.  Would not let the Wash Crew in to wash and wax my RV which Anaheim Resort RV Park will do so I wd rather stay there

Summary Heading: Creepy - just doesn't cut it in 2014
Summary: This is one of (what was once) three parks located close to Disneyland.  It's direct neighbour - "the good one" (Anaheim RV Village) permanently shut it's doors - soon to become a parking lot for Disney employees.  That leaves this RV park, and its competition (located on Midway Avenue " Anaheim Resort RV Park") as your only choices if you want to stay anywhere near Disneyland.   Anaheim Harbor was less expensive and closer to Disney than Resort RV Park, so we thought we would give it a try.  The park is a bizarre mix of people that live full time in the RVs and tourists coming to visit Anaheim.   The staff clearly have no idea how to differentiate from the legitimate tourists and their crackhead full timers - and their attitude towards you shows. There are two very helpful you

This is our third stay here.  The accomodations are good, price is reasonable, only 5 mins. to Disneyland.  I just wish the internet was better and the bathrooms were opened earlier like 6 a.m. for the earlybirds.  The bathroom currently opens at 8 a.m. and closes I think at 9 p.m.  But the overall experience was good.

Summary Heading: Great Place to park the RV for Disneyland
Summary: We are new the the whole RV experience.  I was not sure how I felt about staying in an RV and going to Disney.  This place was the perfect location.  We watched fireworks from the pool at night. The shuttle to Disney was easy and fast and we filled all our days.  Made the RV trip a success.

I've camped here twice during Disneyland trips and it's been great.  The only downside was that I wasn't able to use my AAA discount because I couldn't make it into the office to show my card during the open hours.  Also, if you are a light sleeper, the sound of the traffic may bother you, so be sure to request a campsite near the rear of the park if you can. The bathrooms are clean and have combination lock entries, so you don't have to worry about random people off the street coming in to use them.  The showers are located in the central bathroom near the pool, laundry room and community room.  Again, nice and clean.  I was able to do laundry here and watch tv in the community room while I waited.  It feels safe at this park.  The first time I arrived there, it was past

Decent park, would be better if all of the spaces were not back ins, really is a pain if you are towing a car. Also would be better if there was a space where dogs could be off leash and run a little. We really missed some grass at our site, next time we'll know. Quiet, for it's location and everything was clean.

Summary Heading: It was clean, nice, self, I loved my stay. I was able to walk to Disneyland and feel saelf.
Summary: I stayed at one of their tent sites, I wish they had more then just three. I loved the area for the tents, only draw back it the hook ups are for RV and you had to buy a part to make you plugs ins work. I wish they had just the stand elec hook-ups for the tent area. The Bathrooms were clean at all times, the Showers are clean. Over all it is a great place to stay. It has a few draw backs, the Office hours are not that long, The two girls on the morning shift could have been a little more friendly and helpful. The Young Man that check me in was very friendly and helpful, told me about the restrooms, where to park , how to set up, how t walk to Disneyland, place to see around the area. He was super friendly and helpful, I just was the two girls in the morning shifts were that

Is this the greatest RV park on the planet? No. Is it just a few blocks from the Happiest place on Earth? Yes.  So really there you have it. It takes a quick walker just over 11 minutes to be a the gates of Disneyland. Don't buy the ART ticket, unless you don't need the exercise to work off those unavoidable yet delicious temptations within Disney.  Now, we did park next to the road, Harbor boulevard just as the name implies, and it was loud. You should be prepared for that. We used a brown noise mp3 that kept us sleeping.  They do have a pool and it is clean. It's not warm or large, but it exists. At least it wasn't warm enough for us in December.  The staff was never anything but smiling and happy with us. They allowed us to ship to them and were accommodating in every way

Summary Heading: A place to park the RV
Summary: Reading a bunch of other reviews, I can see their point.  The Park is really just a lot with spaces and hookups.  Nothing special.  There is a pool and a small playground with a grass section.  The bathrooms are locked at night, but with a key that can be had for a small, refundable deposit, they are accessible.  We had no problem getting in and out of the park and had two slots for the RV and car.  Backing into the slot was simple.  The hookups were easy to access and we had no issues with the staff.  Perhaps some people expect more, but for a place to lay our heads after a long day at Disneyland or other Southern CA locales, it was fine for us.  Much, much cheaper than staying in a hotel.

fantastic time, we have 3 children, and the shuttle to Disneyland, is located right by the rv park! Excellent prices, and customer friendly staff! the bathrooms were clean too! Thank you so much!  There is pizza right next door, and we even walked to Disneyland too!

1) grossly overpriced 2) NO pull-thru's 3) tight spaces (could barely back in our 40ft rv WITHOUT slide-outs) 4) inconvenient hook-ups (in very back of space) 5) extremely rude staff (acted inconvenienced by ANY request) 6) restroom hours: 8am-9pm (yes, the restrooms have hours) 7) restroom cleaning time: between 8am-12noon (you'd think they would clean the restrooms when they're closed) 8) disgusting restrooms and showers (hair and trash in drain, cigarette butts and ashes in window sill, filthy floors, no shelves inside to set shampoo/soap or our outside to set clothes)  Recommendation: stay at Anaheim RV Village (we would have stayed there but they were full, no wonder)

Believe it or not but someone recommended this park to us so I booked online before getting there, big mistake.  The toilets and showers were dirty with hair in the drain holes (it appeared that it was the same each day we were there, I don't know if they were cleaned at all).  We have two kids and I did not feel safe there.  There was also not much room between sites, we couldn't put our annex out as it would have hit the RV next to us. The only positive is that it is within walking distance to Disneyland but so is the RV Village across the road.

This is more like a trashy trailer park. Most of the people there, live there. We ended up only staying 2 nights instead of 3.  For a much nicer place, look across the street at Anaheim Harbor RV Village.  We accidentally drove through that park first. It was really nice.  Nice grass, an RV wash, and nobody living there as their home.  One night there was someone playing a radio with so much bass, you just kept feeling the boom and couldn't sleep.

Summary Heading: I was only in it for Disneyland
Summary: First off, the only reason to be at this park is to be within walking distance of Disney at an affordable price.   Secondly, this is not a tenting park, no matter what the website tells you. It is a concrete RV parking lot, with a tiny bit of dirt and sparse grass between the restrooms and the arcade which is too small to fit a RV. And thus, the "campground" was born.  At $40/night, you are paying for a tiny amount of ground to pitch your tent onto. There is one picnic table to be shared between the three sites, and you have zero privacy. In fact, if the tents are a decent size, you may have less than three feet between yourself and the other campers.   However, considering the price of real estate in the area, it's not an awful rate to pay to be so close to the parks. And you

The park itself was great. The price unbeatable, the staff friendly, and the area so close to Disney. My family and I stayed for 5 days and 4 nights in a tent. We felt safe but could not get any sleep until after nearly 1am! The tent camps are right next to the bathrooms (about 5 feet away) so instead of having common courtesy at those hours, we were kept awake by large yelling groups of Asians screaming back and forth from the mens and womens facilities. The worst part is that at 530-630 am, you get to experience the whole terrible situation all over again.  The camp keeps the bathrooms locked all night but each patron gets a key, so while the place is safe enough, it needs to enforce a quiet time or move the tents away from the restrooms to a quieter area.

Summary Heading: Know it for what it is, and it will be fine
Summary: Low cost, good bathrooms, very close to Disneyland, basic but clean and well maintained sites. Tip - If you leave temporarily with your RV, always place something to indicate the site is still taken i.e. a lawn chair, a cardboard sign. We went to and from Disneyland by taxi for about $7 each way for 6 people -way faster and cheaper than parking a car, and the taxi drops you close to the gate. Looked at most of the RV sites nearby and this best met our needs and wants. Will stay here again.

This was my second stay at this park. The first time I stayed and it was typical rv park camping do I figured I would give it another shot to save money.  Turns out I lost, or was robbed from, way more money than anticipated. After a 10 hour day driving my fiancé and I fell asleep in our tent literally 2 feet from an 8 man tent. We woke up around 5:30 am to find my backpack of clothes and my laptop as well as my cell phone stolen from our tent, as well as our tent unzipped. After waiting 3 hours to ask the office to check the cameras, the manager of the park working the front desk was extremely rude as she informed us the camera that actually works is to protect THEIR equiptment and if she was to check the cameras she would need a "30inute window" because she was extremely busy.
Manager Response: We are extremely sorry to hear about your negative experience at Anaheim Harbor RV Park. We take all safety concerns extremely seriously and since your review have taken appropriate measures to make sure our guests never have to experience what you endured.   Like most RV parks, we had previously employed a security service that would come at random intervals throughout the night and patrol the grounds, which is obviously not sufficient as it leaves the types of gaps in monitoring that I am sure the theft of your belongings occurred during. We have since built a guard shack and changed security services so that there is a highly trained guard on site all night to monitor the security cameras and deal with any suspicious activity.   As for your experience with our front desk team, there is no excuse for not making your experience a higher priority to sort out. I can tell you that we have undergone staffing changes in the time since your review and have received overwhelmingly positive feedback about them. I can't blame you for being hesitant to stay with us again but hope that you can take our improvements into consideration the next time you are looking to stay in the area.

Summary: We stayed here because I didn't know where else to stay... I wished I would have picked another spot.  This place was a parking lot for RV's.  They even gave us 2 spaces because the spots are so small.  When I arrived, I asked if we could have a picnic table at our site and was told that they didn't have any.  We went to Disneyland one day and Angel Stadium another, which was very close by, but there are other RV parks that might have been better.  We didn't enjoy any relaxing time outside of our RV, because as we sat in the parking lot, we could see a helicopter with their spotlight and many cops driving around.  So, we decided to stay in our RV.  It's a good spot to park and stay the night, but that's about it.

Summary Heading: would stay again if heading to Disney
Summary: needed a cheap place to stay. we were tent camping in the parks so looked for camping.  we came from San Diego during the day and stayed the night before we headed to Disney the next day.  we arrived late after the office was closed. it was easy to find our tent site.  we got outtakes pitched and ready for bed.  this was just before the bathrooms closed. because we got in late we were not able to get a key to the bathroom. that was the only bad thing about this place.  we were so close to Disney that we were able to enjoy the nighttime fireworks right from the comfort of our picnic table. this was good since we had to leave Disney the next day before seeing the fireworks. we we packed up and out of there by 6:45 in the morn.  if I bust Disney again I'd finely stay here it's much

We love staying here because its so close to Disneyland and affordable. The tent space is a little limited but we had plenty of peace for our needs. The bathrooms were very clean and much nicer than a typical campground. It's about a 15 minute walk to Disneyland.

My husband and I camped here because we didn't want to pay and arm and  leg to stay in a hotel for our 5 days in the area for Disneyland and whale watching. One big tent and an air matress... BAM, pop up hotel room! Not like the $100 a night our relatives paid the same distance from the park on the hotel side. They offer a Disneyland shuttle for $5 a day RT and the shuttle picks you up 200 ft from the rv park. The camping set up was ok, kind of small bc we were pretty much 3 ft from our neighbors who were very nice. 3 tent spaces on a patch if lawn that is no bigger than 20'X30'. It was right next to the bathrooms which was nice. Good bathrooms and nice showers, though shelves are needed in the showers. It was a nice but small little corner we had in the insanity that is LA. This was a good place to stay...It did feel like we were camping in a parking lot...which we were, but I felt safe and we were very close to the Happiest Place on Earth.  I would have liked to have a community BBQ pit that we could all share.  There were showers in the bathrooms...something I couldn't find in the web page.

Great location near Disneyland. We were tent camping and found this to be a great place to stay for a couple of days while we visited Disneyland. The washrooms were clean and right next to the tenting area. Only problem was that we arrived at the park after the office closed so didn't have a key to washrooms, which closed at 9 pm. Tent site could have been a bit bigger, but the price was right so can't really complain. Would definately stay there again.

Love their sense of humor on the list of "rules". Convenient and clean. Bathrooms nice. Showers could be updated. Got a key to use bathrooms after hours. Just paid a $5 deposit. They mailed the deposit back to me promptly because I had to leave before the office opened. I like that they are locked in the middle of the night to prevent homeless people from entering.

Summary Heading: Not fancy, but it fits the bill
Summary: We wanted a place to park for 2 nights while we went to Disneyland, and this site was just right for that.  It is not upmarket - just a parking space with hook-ups - but it was all we needed.  The staff were very friendly and helpful (in contrast to other, more posh places we've stayed in), and the bathrooms - while they didn't look like much from the outside - were among the cleanest we've experienced; the shower had a good flow.  We were able to walk to Disneyland - it's about a 10-15 minute walk.   We had a key for the bathroom to use during the hours when it is closed (for a $5 refundable fee).  Oh, and when the office was closed, we noticed they had a sign on the door with a map showing spaces available for the night, so if you get there after office hours you just park in

Summary Heading: Didn't pretend to be anything they weren't...
Summary: Chose this for the location and proximity to Disneyland. Not a bad place, clean facilities etc and reasonable pricing. But the bathroom doesn't open until 8am and closes at 9pm. Not very practical for campervans without bathrooms, meant a mad dash to the service station. Most people here are permanent with the roadside frontage for casual bookings, very tight spaces too. Next time we would find somewhere else as we drove to Disneyland anyway.

We arried to find someone elses RV parked in our asigned and pre paid spot and all other spots full. since it was after 5 pm the staff had left for the day and there were no employees to deal with the fact that we had NO WHERE to sleep for the night. there were no visable after hours phone numbers posted on the office and we had to wait till 3am till the person who was parked in our spot returned to their RV. after arguing with them for 20 more minutes they finally started unhooking and moving from our space. 4am we got to bed. in the morning the red headed girl running the office basically told me it was my fault and not the parks problem. we were exhausted all the next day and had a miserable trip. never again! they don't care and just want your money

I was a bit worried about staying here bases off of some of the reviews... I found it to be very decent for the price. We stayed in one of the tent sites. They are small and being right by the bathrooms was a plus and a negative... The bathrooms are clean and kept in good order... However being right next to them meant that everyone walked right next to out tent. Some of these people were rather loud. My only real complaint were the BBQs... I was unable to get them to work and they were a horrible mess inside... But I did not feel unsafe and the staff were all very nice to us... Though one night they forgot to turn off the games in the game room which we were right next to and once the traffic quieted on harbor I woke up to the sounds of the games into repeating over and over

A great place to park a motorhome, the staff is helpful and it is a short walk to Disney,  clean and quite.  Will stay there again, the price is great.  Close to other attractions, we went to see the Space Shuttle and it is awesome, allow yourself about 4 hours cause there  is a lot to see. Very interesting museum.  Great restaurant near by and 3 malls, plus not far from the Swap Meet.

Used this facility for tent camping when planing a multi-day disney trip. We made a reservation on the phone and the gentlemen I talked with was very nice and thorough. When we arrived the reservation was set the the woman at the desk was very nice and helpful especially while telling us about the disney shuttle and where to find the shops. The groundskeeper was EXTREMELY nice and he helped us a lot while setting up our tent. He loaned us an extension cord so that we could inflate our mattress. My friend and I were concerned about the bathroom situation but we found them to be surprisingly comfortably and clean. We didn't need a lot of space but since we were the only ones in the tent camping area (there are only three spots) we had the whole area to ourselves. Overall this was

Summary Heading: Tent sites are very small, but the price is right!
Summary: my family and I stayed there to go to Disneyland for a few days. the tent sites are very small they only have 3 and they are all bunched together and it's like actually the size of 1 camping site for all 3. the bathrooms are right there the earth there are 2 showers and I believe it was 3 bathroom stalls the bathroom is very clean and they cleaned it a several times. I do have to say the staff they were very polite and and the gentleman that helped us check in with very accommodating, he even offered us the 1 of the RV sites to put our tent on since they were larger but we still chose a tent sites because of the grass and the tables. I will say on our last morning there when we were going to check out at 11 o'clock at 7 a.m. there was lots of noise and they had a hey crew that

We have now stayed here 3 times and every time have found the employees courteous and efficient.  Everything is very clean. By our main reason to stay here is that it is a short and easy walk to Disneyland and it is easy to get on and off the freeway. We will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: This is NOT what is advertised
Summary: We made reservations based on the advertisements. We checked in, paid $68 per night with a credit card and were assigned two angle-in parking spaces in an asphalt parking lot. No grass, no table, no NOTHING.  We went back to say this is not what we want and were told VERY curtly that thay do NOT give refunds. I said, but we don't want a refund, we just want to cancel the whole deal, you just ran my card, you can just reverse it. They repeated louder, we do NOT give refunds.  We tried to hook up our cable and found that you must "purchase" an adapter to use the "free" cable. When I complained about this I was told rudely that "Everybody that stays here has one of these adapters! You can buy them at Walmart."  The staff was at the very least unattentive.  I had to wait for several

Summary Heading: Disneyland RV parking - full hookups, warm pool, laundry, store
Summary: We go to the Anaheim Harbor RV Park regularly.  Mostly, we park there when going to Disneyland with our annual passes.  We HAVE been boarding our 4 dogs at the Disneyland Kennel, and parking at the Disneyland parking.  However, this time, we decided to keep our dogs in crates in our air-conditioned trailer, and WALK to Disneyland.  It was .7 miles to walk, and we saved $80 on kennels!  The walk was really no more than the walk from parking, and took less time!  Too bad it took us so long to figure that out.  We are very pleased with Anaheim Harbor RV Park's location, cost, staff, property, and amenities.  No need to try anywhere else!  (By the way, it is also fairly close to the Honda Center and the Angel's Stadium - a short drive!)

Good location, good management. Anaheim Harbor RV Park is only a few miles from Disneyland! The area is easy to drive through and find and it looks nice and safe. The bathrooms were very clean and the amenities are fairly new.  I contacted the manager via email and received an instant courteous response as well. I will definitely keep this place in mind the next time I am in the area.  **Prices are also very reasonable

We stayed here for 2 nights. We had two paved parking spots, one for our trailer and one for the truck. There was no grass or picnic table and the next family were right beside us. The bathrooms were cleaned frequently but there were not enough showers for everyone. I had to use earplugs because of extreme traffic noise. The laudry room was great, clean and inexpensive. The pool was small but we were always the only ones swimming which was nice, I guess everyone else was at disneyland. You can easily walk to Disneyland from this park although again you have to walk over I5 highway which isn't that great but you do go by Starbucks on the way. The park is fine if you are wanting to spend some time at Disneyland but too noisy to stay for long.

The Anaheim Harbor RV Park made it possible for us to combine "primitive" camping (as could be within an RV park) with our first trip to Disneyland. We walked to and from the park with our three young sons , 3 days in a row. The RR facilities were nice,and the game room/pool was a nice touch. The money that we saved on lodging and transportation allowed for us to have a more relaxed and joyful experience at Disney.  The only suggestion we would make is that the main office open and hour earlier.

We have had our RV parked here for over 6 months now.  The location is super convenient with several major Freeways minutes away and Disneyland right around the corner.  The RV Park is safe and well maintained with a friendly staff.  We would definitely recommend the Park to friends and family.  It's just what we wanted.

Summary Heading: Do NOT be fooled by their website and old reviews
Summary: We booked a weeks stay at Anaheim Harbor RV Park for a family vacation and trip to Disneyland.  We were impressed with their website so thought this would be great.  Their website does NOT show accurate photos.  We were given 2 asphalt parking spots, no grass, no flowers, no picnic table. The spots were one for our trailer and one for our vehicle.  They have full-time residents in the back and they place looks terrible.  After unhooking our trailer we decided this "RV Park" would not work for our needs.  We went back into the office and were told they (both Manager and Assistant Manager) were not authorized to give a refund as we paid for the whole week upon arrival. They do not give refunds once payment is made.  Make sure if you decide to stay to ask to see your assigned sight

I'm writing to alert others about this RV Resort.  I recently completed a stay at this park, and i'm not all that happy about my stay.  Decided to just hit the road for the holiday, and enjoy disneyland at the same time with my kids! Reviews mostly seemed positive about the park, so I placed a reservation to stay here for a while. Upon coming in though, it was not all that expected. Many spots in the back of  the park had mounds of dried brush all over that looks like it has been there for a couple of months.  I found management to be less then reliable also for any problems I may have had. Park WIFI did not work at all, extremely slow and frequently drops out! Seeing them in the office was rare, Always had a sign in the window mentioning they went out. If I could actually deal

Summary Heading: Great Place, Great Experience, Great Location
Summary: The park was clean and very convenient.  The staff was extremely friendly, and helpful. There is an on site pool for the kids and a putting green.  There was a shuttle that took us back and forth to Disney Land.  I had a great time and would stay here many more times.

Summary Heading: Good location to Disneyland if you're looking for a parking lot
Summary: This place is terribly noisy due to Harbor Blvd. noise.  We were put right on the street although they had room in the back which would have been much quieter and were less than 1/2 full.  The office staff completely ignored us when making coffee in the morning and finally got around to us after we stood there watching her for 5 minutes.  Worst of all the hookups are at the rear of the rig so you better have a looong sewer hose to reach the hookups.  We actually saw large motorhomes pulling in sideways across empty spaces to dump before leaving becasue the hookups were too far from your RV.  These were obviously placed as an afterthought when converting this parking lot to a "Resort".  Very poor planning.  Lots of live-ins and rather seedy location.  We will not stay here again.

I thought that this RV park was great. The staff were very friendly and helpful. When I asked for a site that was farther away from the road, they were happy to oblige and help me in any way they could, even though they were almost booked solid. The park is clean and the restrooms even have granite countertops. There is no grass at the sites except a small patch at the back, but there is a place to take your dogs to use the restroom. I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: RV Park is just that -- a place to park.
Summary: We mistook this location to be an RV resort.  It's an RV park where people live.  There are public restrooms, a laundry room and pool.  They rent the front spaces to people are just looking for a place to drop their rig.  It's fine for that, but if you plan to spend anytime in your rig, be aware, you're parked in a parking lot.  That's it.  They reserved two spaces for us because we had slide outs.  Asked if they take dogs.  Yes they do, but there's no place to walk them.  Signs all over saying "No dogs on the grass."  Very close to Disneyland.  So close that at 9:30pm when Disneyland shoots off their evening fireworks, the concussion is so strong, it's setting off car alarms.  We weren't interested in Disneyland.  Wouldn't stay there again.
